question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/cross_shard_state_view.rs] [Function: set_value()] [Race condition - Critical] Since set_value() takes &self (not &mut self) and cross_shard_data is a HashMap without internal synchronization, can multiple threads concurrently call set_value() for different keys causing data races when the HashMap's internal structure is modified, leading to memory corruption and undefined behavior? (Critical)

(Critical)
